info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:38PM CDT until June 14 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN SHERIDAN...WESTERN PIERCE AND SOUTHEASTERN MCHENRY COUNTIES... At 937 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rugby to 6 miles north of Balta to 13 miles west of Esmond to 8 miles northeast of Anamoose to 6 miles southwest of Martin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rugby, Anamoose, Martin, Balta, Berwick, Sheyenne Lake, Krueger Lake, Silva and Orrin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
